title: Packers continue impressive start to season with victory over Commanders
content: Remember when the Packers couldn't beat any playoff-caliber teams? Not anymore, after their last two wins.

title: Ekeler feared to have torn Achilles, sources say
content: The Commanders fear veteran running back Austin Ekeler tore his right Achilles in the fourth quarter of Thursday night's 27-18 loss to the Packers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. He will undergo additional testing Friday.

title: WR Reed breaks collarbone in Packers' victory
content: Packers wide receiver Jayden Reed broke his collarbone on a play that didn't count during the opening drive of Thursday's 27-18 win against the Commanders.

title: Collier states MVP case with rare 50-40-90 year
content: Lynx forward Napheesa Collier wrapped her MVP case by becoming just the second player in WNBA history to finish a regular season with a 50-40-90 shooting split.

title: Judge belts 2 HRs, ties DiMaggio on Yanks' list
content: Just two days after passing Yogi Berra on the Yankees' all-time home run list, Aaron Judge hit two homers Thursday to tie Joe DiMaggio for fourth with 361 career home runs.

title: Trout ends career-long drought with 399th homer
content: Mike Trout hit his first homer since Aug. 6, launching the 399th blast of his career in a 7-6 loss to the Mariners.

title: Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clippers partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: Costa Rica hotel raided in Gardner investigation
content: Authorities in Costa Rica on Thursday raided the hotel in which the 14-year-old son of former Yankees outfielder Brett Gardner was found dead.

content: The reservoir with a total capacity of 71.5 tmc is full, as the catchment area witnessed a good monsoon

content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy, however, add a rider that they would monitor the project continuously and issue appropriate directions if any harm is caused to the pachyderms

content: Mr. Bhatti Vikramarka wants officials to utilise AI technologies on regular basis to identify areas of losses

title: Tejashwi set to embark on Bihar Adhikar Yatra
content: Before the likely announcement of Assembly polls next month, RJD leader and Leader of Opposition in the State Assembly is expected to continue the momentum of the Opposition provided by the Voter Adhikar Yatra

content: The sessions covered a range of issues relevant to startups, from personal brand building to accessing grants

content: The land pooled in the first phase is sufficient for the current needs, but more land is required for future expansion of the capital region, he says

title: Gaganachukki Jalapathothsava to be plastic-free, says MLA
content: The festival will be organised in a grand manner with a grant of ‚Çπ2.5 crore from the Department of Kannada and Culture and Department of Tourism, says MLA

content: Work on the RoB, between Udupi and Manipal on NH 169A atop Mangaluru-Mumbai Railway line was on since 2018

title: VSU to set up Glass and Glazing Skill Centre
content: The centre will play a vital role in enhancing employment opportunities for the VSU students in the glass industry, says Vice-Chancellor Prof. Allam Srinivasa Rao

title: Cabinet to discuss SIT report on Gaurav Gogoi‚Äôs Pak links after BTC polls: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: The Chief Minister said a Pakistani citizen and the British wife of the Congress MP played a significant role in an anti-India cartel

title: Former Chief Justice Sushila Karki To Be Nepal's Interim PM: Sources
content: Capping days of speculation, sources have told NDTV that former chief justice Sushila Karki will be the interim prime minister of Nepal and will take oath at 8.45 pm.

title: Doctors Object To Maharashtra's Move To Register Homeopaths In Medical Council
content: Urging the Maharashtra government to withdraw an order that would allow homeopaths to prescribe modern medicines after completing a six-month course in pharmacology, the Indian Medical Association (IMA) wrote to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.

title: What We Know About 22-Year-Old From Utah Who Shot Charlie Kirk
content: US President Donald Trump has said that the suspect in the shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk has been captured.

title: Charlie Kirk Shooter Arrested, Trump Says "Someone Close To Him Turned Him In"
content: US President Donald Trump today said that a suspect accused of fatally shooting conservative activist Charlie Kirk has been taken into custody, adding that the arrest came after "somebody very close to him turned him in."

title: Woman, 65, Dies After Falling From Stairs While Fleeing Monkey Attack In UP: Cops
content: A 65-year-old woman died after falling from the stairs of her house here while trying to escape a monkey attack on Friday, police said.

title: Nepal Protest LIVE Updates: Sushila Karki To Become Interim PM, Anti-Corruption Protests Leave 51 Dead
content: At least 51 people were killed during violent anti-corruption protests in Nepal this week, police said Friday in an updated toll, as the full scale of chaos that toppled the government emerges, AFP reported.

title: Pakistan Shamed At UN, Called "Another State Sponsor Of Terrorism"
content: Pakistan was humbled at the United Nations after a human rights lawyer - Hillel Neuer called out the country for state-sponsored terrorism. The meeting started with the discussion of recent Israeli strikes on Qatar.

title: Man Stands On Top Of Train In Nagpur, Gets Electrocuted, Dies
content: A man standing atop a train died after he accidentally touched a high-tension wire and got electrocuted.

title: PM Modi To Unveil 31 Projects Worth Over Rs 8,000 Crore In Manipur Tomorrow
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate 17 projects and lay foundation stones of 14 others with a total investment of Rs 8,500 crore in Manipur on Saturday, a top official said on Friday.

title: Delhi High Court Allows Sunjay Kapur's Wife's Plea To Modify Order Over Husband's Will
content: The Delhi High Court on Friday allowed an application filed by Priya Kapur seeking removal of late husband Sunjay Kapur's sister's name from its order in proceedings related to his purported will.

title: Trump To Meet Qatari Prime Minister Days After Israeli Attack In Doha
content: President Donald Trump planned to meet the Qatari prime minister in New York on Friday, a White House official said, days after US ally Israel attacked Hamas leaders in Doha.

title: Video: SpiceJet Plane Loses Wheel During Take-Off, Lands Safely In Mumbai
content: A SpiceJet plane, which was heading to Mumbai, lost a wheel during take-off at the Kandla airport in Gujarat on Friday.

title: India Home Prices Set To Soar, Pushing Millions Into Costly Rentals
content: Home prices in India are set to rise faster than expected, fuelled by demand from wealthy buyers, while a shrinking supply of affordable housing is likely to keep many stuck in ever more expensive rentals, a Reuters poll of property experts found.

title: Charlie Kirk Assassination Updates: Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect In Custody, Says Donald Trump
content: Charlie Kirk Shooting¬†Updates: Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist and close ally of US President Donald Trump, was shot dead at a Utah college event.

title: South Asian University Sacks Professor Who Backed 2022 Student Protests
content: The South Asian University (SAU) in New Delhi has sacked a professor, two years after suspending him for allegedly backing student protests against stipend cuts.

title: "Can't Wear Rose-Tinted Glasses": Russia Says Ukraine Peace Talks On Pause
content: The Kremlin said Friday that peace talks between Russia and Ukraine were on "pause" as US President Donald Trump's efforts to end the three-and-a-half-year conflict falter.

title: Delhi Police Busts Drugs Racket, 3 Arrested With Cocaine Worth Rs 2 Crore: Cops
content: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has busted a narcotics racket by arresting three men, including a Nigerian national, and seized 194 gm of cocaine worth Rs 2.25 crore from their possession, officials said on Friday.

title: Kerala Police Recover Skeletal Remains Of Man Buried By Friends In 2019
content: Police on Friday recovered skeletal remains suspected to be those of a 35-year-old man allegedly buried by his friends in 2019 after they claimed he died of a drug overdose.

title: How Nepal PM Contender's Husband Was Involved In 1973 Plane Hijacking
content: Sushila Karki, former chief justice of Nepal and a likely frontrunner for the country's interim premiership, has drawn attention for her husband's role in a plane hijacking 52 years ago.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Farmers exploited at every step in agricultural marketing: Minister Patil
content: Minister called for reforms and stressed that prosperity would come only when farmers themselves are empowered to set prices for what they grow

title: Officers involved in illegal storage of rice in Gurmitkal should also be booked, say activists
content: How is it possible to store such quantity of rice without the knowledge of officers involved in it? ask activists

title: Supporters of Ramadoss and ‚Äòexpelled‚Äô leader Anbumani clash over access to Vanniyar Sangam office
content: The two sides -- led by Jayaraj, district secretary of the PMK, and Shankar, Mr. Anbumani‚Äôs supporter -- nearly exchanged blows

title: 21% MPs, MLAs, MLCs have dynastic background; highest presence in Lok Sabha: ADR
content: The Congress has the highest share at 32%, followed by the BJP at 18%. The CPI(M) has the lowest, with just 8% of its members from political families. Among States, Uttar Pradesh tops in absolute numbers with 141 dynasts, followed by Maharashtra (129), Bihar (96) and Karnataka (94)

title: When India sent a ‚Çπ6 crore bill for the annexation of Hyderabad
content: The Indian Army‚Äôs ‚Äòpolice action‚Äô was brief because it had been meticulously set in motion for over six months; The decision to make Hyderabad foot the bill for its own annexation was both symbolic and practical. Symbolic, in that it placed responsibility squarely on a regime that resisted democratic integration. Practical, in that it relieved India‚Äôs strained Central budget during the chaos of Partition and war in Kashmir

title: Karnataka issues draft rules to fix cinema ticket prices at ‚Çπ200 in State
content: However, multi-screen cinemas with premium facilities of 75 seats or less are exempted from the maximum ticket price limit of ‚Çπ200.

title: Factories told to sign agreements with sugarcane growers by October 10
content: They have been asked to clearly spell out the price per tonne, transport costs and other conditions in the agreements

title: 177 students of school near Chikkodi fall ill in suspected case of food poisoning
content: While some students complain of uneasiness and stomachache after having breakfast, others suffer from vomiting and weakness

title: ‚ÄòVote chori‚Äô main issue before country today, PM‚Äôs Manipur visit now no ‚Äòbig deal‚Äô: Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress MP sought to downplay PM Modi tour to Manipur, saying the main issue today in India is ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô (vote theft)

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin opposes¬†Centre‚Äôs notification on exemption of atomic mineral mining from public consultation
content: Such a significant policy change must be discussed in Parliament and Assemblies, with due consultation of the States and members of the public. Otherwise, it would run counter to the spirit of cooperative federalism and the democratic ethos of our country, says the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister

content: Source apportionment study soon in Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram as part of identifying sources of pollution in the ambient air

content: The 10-month study investigates the disaster‚Äôs causes and offers actionable recommendations to prevent future tragedies, will be released to public on September 13

title: Minister releases trailer of documentary showcasing Tamil Nadu‚Äôs wildlife
content: The film, ‚ÄòWild Tamil Nadu‚Äô, has been directed by Emmy-nominated filmmaker Kalyan Varma of Nature in Focus

title: BJP MLA's video of '10% commission' remark goes viral
content: In the video, the Kidwai Nagar MLA was seen asking party workers that while legislators benefit from both salaries and commissions, grassroots workers get "nothing in return."

title: BSWML steps up plastic-free drive, seizes 24.57 tonnes of single-use plastic in Bengaluru, enables residents to file complaints 24/7
content: BSWML has strengthened grievance redressal mechanisms. Residents can now file complaints 24/7 through a digital platform, the Namma Bengaluru app, the toll-free helpline (1533), or the WhatsApp number (9448197197)

title: Left-backed Syndicate members of Kerala University push for urgent meet after HC verdict on Registrar suspension
content: Kerala HC had decided to leave the matter of revoking the Registrar‚Äôs suspension to the Syndicate‚Äôs discretion

content: Congress members insisted that they were rescuing the secretary, who was being forced to conduct election of directors in favour of the BJP

content: The committee has also initiated steps to improve financial transparency and infrastructure. It has requested for a special audit of the temple's finances

content: According to him, the conditions listed by the police for his party‚Äôs public meetings and programmes were ‚Äúunprecedented.‚Äù¬†

content: Akhila Bharatha Veerashaiva Mahasabha has given a call to Veerashaiva-Lingayats to identify themselves under ‚Äòothers‚Äô in the religion category, and enumerate themselves as Veerashiava-Lingayats

content: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference leader says immediate restoration of statehood is key ‚Äònot just to win back the confidence of tourists but also to ensure holistic development of J&K‚Äô

content: Parents requested the Union government and Telangana Chief Minister to assist in bringing back the victim‚Äôs mortal remains to Hyderabad

title: Vasan urges T.N. government to strengthen infrastructure in paddy procurement centres
content: In a statement, Mr. Vasan said nearly one lakh sacks of paddy stored at a DPC at Vriddachalam in Cuddalore district were left in the open and got soaked in the recent rains

title: Southwest monsoon withdrawal likely to begin around September 15: IMD
content: IMD predicts Southwest Monsoon withdrawal from northwest India around September 15, earlier than usual.

title: Mauritius PM offers prayers at Ram temple in Ayodhya
content: Mr. Ramgoolam along with his wife Veena Ramgoolam also reviewed the temple construction work and received updates on its progress, officials said

title: Supreme Court circular bans shooting photos, reels, videography within its high security zone
content: The circular urged media professionals to conduct interviews and live broadcast of news at the designated lawns adjacent to the compound‚Äôs outer gates, considered a low security zone

title: Eminent doctors to be roped-in for voluntary service in TTD
content: As part of the initiative, the TTD will soon launch an exclusive mobile application to streamline registrations

title: Srisailam temple management to plant 2,000 bilva trees in the temple town
content: We planned to plant divine trees, flower-bearing trees, ornamental trees and others in a planned manner to give shelter from heat to the visiting devotees at parking places and open places, Temple EO said

title: Institute of Mental Health: A journey of healing beyond stigma, silence and shame
content: The Institute of Mental Health in Hyderabad stands as a psychiatric lifeline, drawing patients from far-flung districts and even neighbouring States in search of care. For over a century, it has balanced treatment with compassion while confronting the invisible yet powerful burden of social stigma.¬†Siddharth Kumar Singh¬†traces the stories behind the hospital gates, capturing how healing, resilience and empathy quietly intersect in the ongoing fight to make mental health a visible priority

title: Velachery Congress MLA moves Madras High Court challenging ECI‚Äôs disqualification notice
content: The Election Commission had sought an explanation as to why he should not be disqualified for reportedly not having made a true disclosure of his 2021 election expenditure

title: Who is Tyler Robinson? Suspect arrested over Charlie Kirk‚Äôs murder
content: Tyler Robinson, a 22-year-old from Utah, has been apprehended in connection with the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. President Trump confirmed the arrest, stating the suspect was identified and turned in by an acquaintance. Kirk was fatally shot while addressing a crowd at Utah Valley University, prompting a massive investigation and outpouring of tips.

title: Asia Cup: Samson receives official batting message - 'He hasn't batted at 5-6'
content: Ahead of the highly anticipated Asia Cup 2025 clash against Pakistan, India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak confirmed Sanju Samson's readiness to bat in the middle order. While the team remains tight-lipped about the final XI, Kotak emphasized the team's focus and competitiveness. He highlighted the flexibility of the batting order and the presence of multiple finishers.

title: 'Might take to streets': Akhilesh's warning over vote chori; points to Nepal unrest
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has accused the Election Commission and the government of enabling "vote theft," warning of potential Nepal-like street protests in India if such practices continue unchecked. Speaking in Lucknow, Yadav cited past Uttar Pradesh polls, alleging caste-based appointments of officials and instances of election manipulation in Rampur, Mirapur, and Ayodhya.

title: Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO: Left no choice
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Meet Diella: Albania appoints world‚Äôs first 'AI minister'; what's her role?
content: Albania has appointed Diella, an AI-powered minister, to combat corruption and enhance transparency in public spending. Overseeing government contracts, Diella aims to eliminate bias and manipulation, addressing Albania's long-standing struggle with corruption. This move aligns with Albania's EU accession goals, potentially strengthening credibility by ensuring corruption-free allocation of funds.

title: Tesla engineer resigns after 8 yrs; points to Musk as reason, accuses him of lying
content: After eight years with Tesla, a senior engineer, Giorgio Balestrieri, has resigned, citing concerns over Elon Musk's leadership and its detrimental impact on Tesla's mission. Balestrieri praised his colleagues and the company's growth in energy storage but criticized Musk for allegedly lying to the public, manipulating discourse, and supporting climate change deniers.

title: 'She‚Äôs not obsessed': Blake Lively shuts the door on Taylor Swift friendship
content: Reports indicate a rift between Taylor Swift and Blake Lively, with Lively seemingly accepting the end of their long-standing friendship. Sources suggest Lively is no longer preoccupied with Swift's life, particularly her engagement to Travis Kelce. Despite past attempts at reconciliation, Swift has remained unresponsive, and Lively is now focused on her own life.

title: Love is in the air! R Ashwin shares romantic picture with wife
content: Ravichandran Ashwin ended his IPL career after 16 seasons. He cited the demanding schedule as a key factor. Ashwin also expressed interest in exploring opportunities in other global leagues. He shared a romantic picture with his wife on social media. This highlighted his devotion to family. Ashwin retired from international cricket in December 2024.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
content: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Trump says patience with Putin 'running out fast'
content: Donald Trump expressed dwindling patience with Vladimir Putin amid stalled peace talks between Russia and Ukraine. Despite Trump's diplomatic efforts, Russia continues its offensive, leading to a negotiation standstill. Poland refuted Trump's suggestion that a Russian drone incursion was accidental, asserting it was a deliberate act, raising security concerns in Europe and testing NATO's resolve as the conflict persists.

title: Watch: Wheel falls off SpiceJet plane after take-off; pilots declare full emergency
content: A SpiceJet aircraft, en route to Mumbai from Kandla, experienced a tyre detachment during take-off. The incident prompted the pilots to declare a full emergency upon approach to Mumbai. Despite the loss of the tyre, the aircraft successfully landed, and all passengers disembarked without incident, as confirmed by a SpiceJet spokesperson.

title: Maharashtra govt renames Ahmednagar railway station- What is new name
content: The Maharashtra government has officially renamed Ahmednagar railway station to Ahilyanagar Railway Station, following Union Home Ministry approval. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar expressed gratitude to central ministers for fulfilling this long-pending demand, coinciding with Ahilyadevi Holkar's 300th birth anniversary. Meanwhile, Devendra Fadnavis criticized Karnataka's proposal to rename Bengaluru's Shivajinagar metro station, deeming it an insult to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

title: Read: Raj Kundra denies Rs 60 cr fraud allegations; Manoj Bajpayee on stardom & more
content: Bollywood buzz includes Raj Kundra's denial of fraud allegations and the Delhi High Court's protection of Abhishek Bachchan's personality rights. Manoj Bajpayee shared his views on fame compared to Shah Rukh and Salman Khan. Vivek Oberoi addressed comments about his relationship with cousin Akshay Oberoi. Finally, Shah Rukh Khan's youthful diet and fitness regime at 59 were revealed.

title: Dev Anand's untold love story: He was 48 and she was 20 when 'desperately in love'
content: Dev Anand fell deeply in love with this actress after casting her in his film. He was captivated by her charm. Dev Anand planned to confess his feelings at the Taj. However, he saw another actor flirting with her at a party, and she reciprocated, leading Dev Anand to step back. This actress was unaware of Dev Anand's emotions.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Kremlin 'pauses' peace talks; Trump's truce move falters
content: Kremlin announced a pause in Russia-Ukraine peace talks. Donald Trump's efforts to mediate face challenges. Russia continues its offensive. Putin has ruled out meeting Zelenskyy. Recent attacks have escalated. Previous talks yielded prisoner swaps. Russia demands Donbas, while Ukraine seeks European peacekeepers. Poland rejects Trump's view on a Russian drone incursion, calling it deliberate.

title: 'Parallel BJP in Ambala': Anil Vij claims; his 'blessing' remark raises eyebrows
content: Anil Vij, a BJP MLA, has stirred controversy. He claims a parallel BJP operates in Ambala Cantonment. Vij suggests this faction has high-level support. He previously criticized Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini and state party chief Mohan Lal Badoli. Vij alleged collusion against him during the last election. The party issued Vij a show-cause notice for his remarks.

title: Asia Cup: Why do Pakistan lose to India 'most of the times'? Ex-captain answers
content: Rashid Latif believes Pakistan's emotional approach in India matches leads to losses, contrasting with India's composed play. He praised India's balanced team, highlighting Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah as key strengths. Latif acknowledged Pakistan's pressure but notes India's lack of recent T20I experience as a potential disadvantage, while spotlighting Sahibzada Farhan as a potential game-changer.

title: 'Reality check': Lessons learnt from Op Sindoor; 'capability gaps' identified
content: Defence secretary Rajesh Kumar Singh stated that Operation Sindoor, a punitive strike on terror bases in Pakistan, served as a crucial assessment of India's defense capabilities. The operation exposed gaps in electronic warfare, counter-unmanned systems, and low-level radar technology. India is focusing on indigenous defense production and collaborating with DRDO to achieve self-reliance in defense.

title: Solar Eclipse 2025: When is Surya Grahan--on 20, 21, or 23 September?
content: The final solar eclipse of 2025, a partial one, is set to occur on September 21st, coinciding with the September equinox. This celestial event will be primarily visible in the Southern Hemisphere, offering spectacular views in New Zealand, parts of eastern Australia, and Antarctica. Observers in these regions will witness the Moon partially obscure the Sun, creating a crescent glow.

title: Gracie Hunt net worth: Kansas City Chiefs heiress building her own legacy
content: Gracie Hunt, heiress to the Kansas City Chiefs' co-ownership, has amassed a $3 million fortune at just 23. Beyond her family's wealth, Gracie is forging her own path through philanthropy, pageantry, and sports management. Her journey from Miss Kansas USA to pursuing a Master's in Sport Management showcases her ambition and dedication to creating a personal legacy.

title: Asia Cup | 'Who is SRK?' - Pak player gets trolled for 'Hollywood actor' post
content: Pakistani cricketer Iftikhar Ahmed's playful Instagram post ignited social media ahead of the Asia Cup clash with India, drawing humorous reactions from fans. Despite the lighthearted moment, former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif cautioned against over-exuberance, citing India's consistent performance under pressure. Latif emphasized Hardik Pandya and Jasprit Bumrah as key players for India, while acknowledging Pakistan's potential spin advantage.

title: NEET PG Supreme Court hearing postponed: When is the next date?
content: The Supreme Court of India has postponed the hearing on the NEET PG 2025 transparency plea for two weeks, prolonging uncertainty for medical aspirants. Petitioners challenged NBEMS‚Äôs corrective notice that provided only question IDs instead of full questions and answer keys, arguing the format prevents proper verification. They seek complete disclosure, citing transparency practices in exams like JEE, CLAT, and AIIMS INI-CET.

title: 'Unusual president': Tharoor slams Trump over India policy - shares impact of US tariff
content: Shashi Tharoor criticized Donald Trump's unpredictable policies and tariffs, highlighting their damaging impact on India's economy, including job losses in key export sectors. He described Trump as disregarding diplomatic norms with unusual remarks and unfair sanctions on India for importing Russian oil, while China faces no such penalties.

title: 'The Bengal Files' BO collection day 8: Vivek Agnihotri movie has slow start on second Friday
content: At the box office, 'The Conjuring: Last Rites' outperformed both 'Baaghi 4' and 'The Bengal Files', earning Rs 67.87 crore in its first week. 'Baaghi 4' failed to reach Rs 50 crore, while 'The Bengal Files' earned Rs 11.25 crore in week 1.

title: Matthew Hayden to 'walk nude'? Daughter Grace makes plea to Joe Root
content: Former Australian opener Matthew Hayden has ignited social media with a bold prediction: Joe Root will score his first Test century in Australia during the upcoming Ashes series. Hayden jokingly promised to walk nude around the MCG if Root fails to reach the milestone. Root's stellar Test record includes 13,543 runs and 39 centuries, but none in Australia.

title: Charlie Kirk: X mourns him as free speech martyr; nation debates violence
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk was assassinated during a debate on free speech at Utah Valley University. His death, framed as a martyrdom for free expression, has ignited debates over political violence and polarization in the U.S. Turning Point USA now faces a leadership vacuum and heightened security concerns amidst calls for renewed activism.

title: Trump admin destroys nearly $10M worth of contraceptives: Report
content: The Trump administration destroyed $9.7 million worth of contraceptives intended for low-income countries, falsely claiming they were abortifacients. Despite offers from organizations like the Gates Foundation to purchase or accept the supplies, the administration proceeded with the destruction. Critics condemn the action as cruel, warning it will cost lives and hinder global health progress.

title: Wayanad tragedy: Congress leader Jose Nelledam found dead; suspected suicide
content: Congress leader Jose Nelledam, a member of the Mullankolli Grama Panchayat in Wayanad, was discovered dead in a pond near his residence on Friday. Kerala police reports suggest he allegedly cut his wrist after consuming poison before jumping into the water. He was rushed to a hospital but was declared dead.

title: Indian-origin man beheaded: Killer seen kicking severed head- What led to grisly murder
content: In a horrific incident, a Dallas motel manager, Chandra Nagamallaiah, was beheaded by Yordanis Cobos-Martinez after an argument over a broken washing machine. The gruesome attack occurred in front of the victim's family, with the suspect later arrested wearing a blood-soaked T-shirt. ICE officials stated Cobos-Martinez, a Cuban national with a criminal history, should not have been in the U.S.

title: Who is Matthew Dowd? MSNBC analyst fired for blaming Charlie Kirk for his own death
content: MSNBC dismissed veteran political analyst Matthew Dowd after he made controversial remarks following the fatal shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Dowd suggested Kirk's rhetoric contributed to the environment leading to his death, sparking widespread condemnation. Despite a swift apology from MSNBC and Dowd's clarification, his contract was terminated immediately, highlighting tensions in media coverage of politically charged incidents.

title: Manipur sees clashes ahead of PM Modi's visit; security tightened
content: In Manipur's Churachandpur district, miscreants clashed with security forces, vandalizing banners and barricades erected for Prime Minister Modi's upcoming visit. The incidents occurred at Pearsonmun village and Phailien Bazar, where items were set ablaze and stones were thrown. Paramilitary forces have since increased patrols to restore order as Modi is scheduled to unveil projects worth Rs 8,500 crore.

title: Panchayat chief, drunk at wheel, mows down whistleblower
content: Samalapuram town panchayat president S Vinayaga Palanisamy has been arrested for allegedly running over K Palanisamy, a daily wager, with his SUV. The victim had previously complained about the president's misuse of panchayat funds to lay a private road. Police investigation revealed that Vinayaga Palanisamy, who was allegedly drunk, intentionally hit K Palanisamy, who died later in hospital.

title: 'What is going on?': Gukesh keeps losing, Sarin keeps winning - Indian chess confronts Janus paradox
content: At the FIDE Grand Swiss in Samarkand, Indian chess presents a contrasting picture. Nihal Sarin shines, securing his third consecutive win and joining the lead. Meanwhile, World Champion D Gukesh struggles, losing his third straight game and risking a drop from the top 10. Despite Nihal's success, he humbly credits Viswanathan Anand and Gukesh for India's chess boom.

title: 'No words left': Man seeing cheering during Charlie Kirk assassination
content: A video has surfaced showing a man celebrating near the scene of Charlie Kirk's assassination at Utah Valley University. The man, seen pumping his fists and shouting "USA! USA! USA!", has sparked outrage online. While his identity remains unverified, an X account claiming to be him denies celebrating the killing, stating his actions were to draw attention for security to escape.

title: YouTuber Tectone reacts to commentator Steven Crowder‚Äôs claims about Charlie Kirk‚Äôs shooter
content: Following Charlie Kirk's tragic shooting, online debates intensified after Steven Crowder shared alleged ATF information. Crowder claimed the shooter's ammunition had engravings linked to transgender and anti-fascist ideology. Reacting to these claims, streamer Tectone amplified the conversation by labeling the suspect a ‚ÄúTrans Radical,‚Äù sparking widespread reactions and further fueling the controversy surrounding the case.

title: IIM Ahmedabad vs IIM Bangalore: Who leads among top B-schools on placements?
content: IIM Ahmedabad retains the top NIRF 2025 rank, but IIM Bangalore edges ahead in placements. With a higher median salary of ‚Çπ32.5 lakh and a perfect placement record, Bangalore outshines Ahmedabad‚Äôs ‚Çπ31 lakh. While Ahmedabad leads in academics and research, Bangalore dominates in recruiter perception and compensation, making the choice between India‚Äôs premier B-schools one of priorities.

title: Now, Bombay HC receives bomb threat email; hearings suspended, building evacuated
content: Bombay High Court faced a bomb threat via email, leading to immediate evacuation. Hearings were suspended as police and bomb squads searched the complex. Delhi High Court also received a similar threat earlier that day. Authorities are conducting thorough searches at both locations. Recent threats targeted various Mumbai establishments. Officials assured the public that there is no need to panic.

title: 'He threw the freakin' shoe!': Revisiting Marco Wilson's infamous toss five years later
content: college football's Marco Wilson throws an LSU player's shoe in the fourth quarter of a rivalry game on Dec. 12, 2020 . the throw, which came in a tie game against a heavy underdog, certainly cost Florida a win . five years later, the play proved a turning point in the history of an once-proud Florida program .

title: Knicks add Brogdon to backcourt on 1-year deal
content: free agent guard has agreed to a one-year deal with the new york Knicks . he averaged 12.7 points, 4.1 assists and 3.8 rebounds last season . the 32-year-old is expected to have a rotation role for new coach Mike Brown .
